flawed_nl_solution:
Susan picked 3 times as much as 36 which is 3*36 = <<3*36=108>>108 apples
She gave out half which is 108*(1/2) = <<108*(1/2)=216/1>>216/1 apples
She now has 108-216/1 = <<108-216/1=-108>>-108 apples
Frank sold a third of 36 which is 36*(1/3) = <<36*(1/3)=12>>12 apples
Frank now has 36-12 = <<36-12=24>>24 apples
Altogether they now have -108+24 = <<-108+24=-84>>-84 apples

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 54, not 216/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
